title: Ansatz for the Two-Dimensional Ising Model in an External Magnetic Field
abstract:
An ansatz applied to the two-dimensional Ising model in an external magnetic
field h gives rise to an exactly soluble model. The singularity in the
magnetization found by Onsager does not survive the presence of the external
magnetic field as found earlier by Lee and Yang in 1952. However, the
singularity in the heat capacity remains even in the presence of the magnetic
field. A surprising result is the presence of negative heat capacity for h > 0.
